column19: Freedom, ironically free transport to me means freedom. Freedom of my mind to not have to worry about using my parents’ already very low finances. In September, I will officially start year 13 - the year decides if I will be able to make my dream come true which is going to university and financially supporting myself. During this year even though it is still the most important year of my life, I will still have to work to support my parents and I will have to travel to many places to gain experiences for my UCAS application. Without the generous free unlimited transport, I possibly don’t see how I can fund these. You may say : ‘Don’t you work?’. Yes, yes I do work but that money goes to my parents straight away without hesitation, they need it a lot more than me to support our family of 6. So free transport to me is a luxury that I am privileged to have obtained but I also understand the governments decision, the pandemic have dissected the economy and dispersed them into pieces which will be hard to bring together unless they think outside the box. So I understand but I’m sure many of the youths and their families will be devastated, some children’s families condition are so bad they may even have to change schools away from their friends after not seeing them for so long or at the very extreme length not even attend school.
